Description:
Kubernetes, OpenShift & Elastic Stack - you love your IT craft and your innovative heart beats for good software solutions? You are guided by tech curiosity and enjoy sharing your expertise with your colleagues? Perfect! At ING, we place great value on team spirit, a productive agile working atmosphere and further training for our employees. Do you think this suits you? Then apply!

The department: Global Tribe Cloud
The purpose of the Global Tribe Cloud is to build and run the target infrastructure platform in a (private) cloud delivery model. This delivery model is based on multi-tenant, self-service, pay-per-use capabilities for application DevOps teams as defined in our One Way of Working. We deliver services for ING engineers worldwide, and onboarding new countries to our private cloud happens all the time.
Tribe Cloud comprises five Global Areas:
The ELKaaS service that we offer is part of the Area Data Services. While the Area Data Services consists of colleagues working in the Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, Germany and India, the 5 engineers currently working on ELKaaS all work in Germany. As ING appreciates the idea of working from home, there is absolutely no requirement to be based in Germany to fulfil this position. However, it would make sense to physically meet up with the team in Germany once in a couple months. And of course, you will also be invited to our yearly internal cloud conference in Amsterdam.


Your toolbox is the towards INGs DevOps teams worldwide: you develop and support global, containerised solutions for log file monitoring and metrics analysis, record and recognize dependencies to other systems and processes, and your team can count on your IT knowledge and process understanding. Our containerized ELKaaS offering runs on OpenShift 4 and all changes are done via our Azure DevOps pipeline. The ELKaaS service is gaining popularity and it is more and more being integrated into core systems of ING, meaning that soon standby shifts (occasionally) will be part of the job.


You don't have to tick all boxes, but if you recognize yourself in some of these things make sure to apply!

We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm

Contact Stella Draskóczy in our TECH recruitment team stella.draskoczy@ing.com for more information about this role. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the "Apply" button.


With 57,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

Description:
As an experienced Security Architect you'll be working in a small team of architects and with all relevant stakeholders. On a larger scale you are member of the Center of Expertise Architects in ING Domestic Bank Netherlands. When applicable you will work with ING colleagues from other areas to ensure alignment. Working at ING means working in a dynamic and international setting.

The Opportunity
You will translate business vision and strategy into effective enterprise by creating, communicating and improving the key principles and models that describe the future state and enable its evolution to deliver the IT Architecture for the organization and its customers. You execute the global Business & IT Roadmap process, with centralized designs and (logical) global decompositions, analyze market- and IT-trends and, based on this information, contribute to the strategy of the organization. Draft logical IT-Roadmaps, monitor and manage the progress of the execution of Business & IT-Roadmaps towards the target state and the use of global standards and solutions.


You will be member of a small team of architects, led by our enterprise architect technical foundation. In creating architecture deliverables, you will work closely with business colleagues, Enterprise Architects, Domain Architects, Feature Engineers, IT managers and Dev/Ops teams.


We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we'll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.

We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm

The benefits of working with us at ING include:

Contact Fabian Nagy in our TE CH recruitment team fabian.nagy@ING.com for more information about this role. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the "Apply" button.

Description:
ING Private Cloud Full Stack Developer

Anyone interested in digital (banking) understands why ING is transforming and working hard towards an IT company having its own unique Top Engineering culture.
We are working hard to stay ahead in being a financial innovator offering the best possible solutions and services to millions of appreciated clients all over the globe.
And therefore we are looking for a Dev/Ops Engineer who helps us offering the best products and services to both our business and private customers. Get an impression here: https://youtu.be/-QknLYEdfyI

Your working environment:

ING's Private Cloud is one of the main projects contributing to the Think Forward Strategy. It's the first step toward helping ING produce the same products and services throughout the entire world. The Private Cloud is set up to simplify and streamline current processes, first by simplifying the infrastructure landscape through standardization. It is also to improve and encourage ING performance culture by creating a highly engaged workforce that embraces the new technology.
One way of supporting our ING DevOps engineers using the ING Private Cloud is by delivering an API, which provides insight on the performance metrics of IPC. To be able to provide the most relevant- and up-to-date information, you will keep close contact with the actual developers of IPC, who are based in three different countries and are distributed over the various tribes in ING.

You will be part of an ambitious- and result driven squad. We have an Agile way of working and are building new functionalities quickly by continuously refining with our users.




Contact Malgorzata Witczak in our Tech recruitment team on malgorzata.witczak@ing.com for more information about this role. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the "Apply" button.

Description:
Are you completing your Masters' or PhD degree from an EU university in 2023? Do you want to make an excellent career move into the Tech industry? Then join the ING IT Class, beginning on 1 September 2023. We are looking for top IT engineers to join us!

This role is based in Amsterdam. Relocation will be provided to candidates from within Europe. If required, we will take care of sponsorship.

Working at ING
ING is a frontrunner in the transformation of banking and a company that puts technology at its heart. The bank is becoming an ever-more tech-driven organisation with an outstanding engineering culture. Our mission is to empower people to stay a step ahead in life and in business and provide products & services that make our customers' life easier. In order to achieve our ambitious goals, we need the very best people, not only experienced professionals, but also the very best starters. The growth of your career is fully dependent on your talent, effort and ambition. The environment allows for many opportunities.


The IT Class offers you the possibility to explore your engineering skills in one year. In this year you will get three personal and one group assignment within different departments of ING. We will make sure you experience different lines of business and work with different techniques such as backend, frontend, ops, etc. In the personal assignments you will be working with an existing and experienced agile team. In the group assignment you will work with IT Class colleagues on an innovation challenge. For the whole first year you will have a dedicated coach and weekly sessions with the IT Class group. Based on your performance in the first year ING will offer you a permanent contract.
Examples of rotations where you can work:

A job of 40 hours and a unique offer that fits in with the times of today located at ING Amsterdam.
To give you an idea, we will tell you about the benefits of working at ING:
On top of that we offer personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities to realize your ambitions in an informal working environment with innovative colleagues who strive for the very best. Discover all our employment conditions here .


You can apply for the IT Class providing your CV, motivation letter and grade lists (Bachelor and Master until now). All documents should be in English.
After a screening phase, you will be invited to complete an online technical assessment. The results will then be analyzed by a Management Committee together with your application documents. In case of a positive assessment, you will be invited for one of our digital selection days in May. The start of the IT Class contract is 1 September 2023.


For more information please go to website or contact us through IT.Class@ing.nl . Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the "Apply" button.


With around 52,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to make a diﬀerence. We hire smart people like you for your potential, not your past. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on more responsibility. In return, we'll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself. If you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible, surrounded by progressive, inspiring and supportive colleagues, there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

Description:
EyeTech Solutions est un cabinet de recrutement international spécialisé dans le placement de professionnels des technologies de l'information au Luxembourg, en Belgique, en France et en Allemagne. Avec plus de 30 ans d'expérience dans le secteur du recrutement, nous travaillons avec une expertise interne spécialisée. Ainsi, nous sommes en mesure d'identifier précisément vos besoins, ce qui nous permet de vous fournir une solution rapide et efficace.

Un seul objectif - vous offrir l'excellence.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated data scientist to join our client's team.The client is an IT provider for software enhacing data migration. Length : 12 Months.

Tasks

Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business problems and design data-driven solutions

Develop statistical models, predictive algorithms, and Machine Learning models to support business decisions

Analyze large, complex data sets to identify patterns, trends, and insights

Present findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

Collaborate with data engineers to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data sources

Continuously evaluate and improve data models to ensure optimal performance and accuracy

Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in data science and Machine Learning

Profile

Master's or PhD in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or related field

3+ years of experience in data science or related field

Proficient in programming languages such as Python or R

Experience with Machine Learning algorithms and statistical modeling

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Excellent communication and presentation skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Cons: ['"L\'inconvénient est le micro management" (in 2 reviews)']

Description:
EyeTech Solutions est un cabinet de recrutement international spécialisé dans le placement de professionnels des technologies de l'information au Luxembourg, en Belgique, en France et en Allemagne. Avec plus de 30 ans d'expérience dans le secteur du recrutement, nous travaillons avec une expertise interne spécialisée. Ainsi, nous sommes en mesure d'identifier précisément vos besoins, ce qui nous permet de vous fournir une solution rapide et efficace.

Un seul objectif - vous offrir l'excellence.

Our client, a well-established company, is seeking a Data Engineer for a 12-month mission to join their team.

The client is active in the banking industry. Start date: 01/03/2023. Daily rate: 550EUR-650EUR.

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for

Designing, developing, and maintaining data Storage and management systems.

Extracting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into the data warehousing systems.

Building and maintaining data pipelines for data integration and analysis.

Implementing data quality checks to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the data.

Collaborating with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions.

Keeping up-to-date with the latest technologies and industry trends, and suggesting ways to improve the existing solutions.

Mentoring junior data engineers and contributing to the growth of the team.

The ideal candidate will have

At least 3 years of experience in data engineering

Strong knowledge of data Storage and management systems such as Hadoop, Spark, and Snowflake

Experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL, and Java

Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau and PowerBI

Understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes

Excellent problem-solving and communication skills

Description:
We are the point of reference in the IT market for the pioneering companies ready to leverage new technological & digital projects, to embrace innovation and to evolve their business.

Born as a carve out from IRIS Group, and with more than 30 years of experience in the management of complex IT environments, we help companies, both private and public to scale up the Digital Transformation path, with a combination of Hybrid Technologies, Managed Services, EIM solutions and High-level Professionals.

Our people wake up every day with the aim to create the new around our customers' need, with an approach devoted to research and innovation and with the pioneering spirit of those who believe in technological progress.

We manage the entire IT stack with integrated Hybrid Technology and Managed Services, while also providing best-in-class IT personnel to support any kind of IT project.

We also provide companies with digital solutions to help the management of information and to optimize business processes.

HYBRID TECHNOLOGIES
Optimal mix of on-premise, private and public cloud with centralized view

MANAGED SERVICES
Centralized support for your hybrid infrastructure and all the managed solutions to keep the business running (from monitoring, backup, disaster recovery and EIM as a service)

STAFFING & SOURCING
The right people for the right project, from ECM services to Hardware, Software and Datacenter services

BPM & EIM
Digital Mailroom, Advanced Case Management, Information Governance, Business Process Automation

We are currently recruiting for our client, a bank located in Luxembourg, a Data Engineer (ETL).

Your mission

As a member of the client's Data department, helped by your recent experience on ETL tools (ideally Oracle Data Integrator), you participate in the project of the new Core Banking System T24 and the exploitation of its data. You'll participate in the delivery of a new Business Datawarehouse and its datamarts, feeding Downstream Components, other applications and supporting Reporting.

Your main objectives will be

To develop and review complex data flows in a moving environment using Oracle Data Integrator and PL/SQL to feed ODS

To help improve the tools and process on Build Factory & DevOps (GIT, Deploy and Release Management tools)

To support technical documentation of the new Datawarehouse

To support analysis of changes with functional banking knowledge

To review requirements before their development

To participate in code review and quality

To support the Integration and the Testing of the development

Your competences

A master's degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or Engineering

English

Well experienced in ETL tool, Oracle Data Integrator experience is a strong advantage.

DevOps mindset and release management experience

Capable of reading a Data Model

Advanced knowledge of SQL querying

General knowledge of the banking products and services

Good knowledge and understanding of the banking processes is an advantage

Good knowledge of Business Reporting Tools (Business Objects/MicroStrategy) is an advantage

Experience in implementation / exploitation of T24 data is an advantage

Your hard skills

Oracle Data Integrator 12 (another ETL can be considered)

Oracle 12/19, SQL

Unix & Shells Scripts

GIT

XL Deploy & XL Release

Interested? Send us your CV via the button below!

Description:
You will join theTechnology Department composed of three teams (1) Data Management; (2) Automation & Industrial Modeling (AIM); and (3) Energy and Decarbonation. Reporting to the Chief Operational Officer of the cluster AM LPL, the department has the mission to deliver new technological solutions to AM LPL plants and contribute to the major projects of the decade for the decarbonization of the metallurgical industry, all supported by a massive deployment of digital technologies to improve performance.
This position is inside the Data Management team.

Missions:
Contribution to the standardisation of AM LPL Automatic Reporting (Power BI, SAP Analytics): daily production, following Production/Maintenance/Quality/ Health & Safety KPIs etc. Support the corresponding teams through the management and analysis of the related data.

Description:
Description
Vous êtes mordu(e) d’innovation et êtes prêt(e) à relever de nouveaux défis captivants ? Vous avez envie de plonger tête la première dans l’univers démesuré du Marketing Digital ? Ne cherchez plus, Editus est l’entreprise qu’il vous faut !

Intégrer Editus c’est se laisser séduire par une entreprise collaborative et « data oriented », qui place la donnée au cœur de ses métiers.
Fun, Target et Team Spirit ça vous parle ? Ce sont justement les valeurs par lesquelles sont animés nos 140 collaborateurs !

Base de données référente à Luxembourg, Editus est aussi le Partenaire Marketing de nombreuses entreprises au niveau local. Notre ambition est de proposer à nos clients des solutions Marketing sur mesure et adaptées à leurs besoins.

Description:
Hays plc est l'un des principaux groupes mondiaux de recrutement de professionnels. Hays est l'expert du recrutement de personnes qualifiées, professionnelles et compétentes dans le monde entier. Hays est le leader du marché au Royaume-Uni et en Asie-Pacifique et également l'un des leaders du marché en Europe continentale et en Amérique latine. Hays intervient pour le compte de milliers d'entreprises des secteurs privé et public, sur des postes en CDI, CDD, Travail Temporaire et Contracting.

Hays France & Luxembourg compte aujourd'hui plus de 650 salariés répartis au sein de 22 bureaux (Aix-en-Provence, Amiens, Biarritz, Bordeaux, Clermont-Ferrand, Dijon, Grenoble, La Rochelle, Lille, Lyon, Montpellier, Nancy, Nantes, Nice, Paris, Reims, Rennes, Rouen, Strasbourg, Toulouse, Tours et au Luxembourg) couvrant 25 secteurs d'activité.

Your tasks

You strengthen an R&D team of fifteen experts, including 10 high-level software developers.

You design and implement state of the arts software solutions in C++, including Hardware interfacing (e.g.cameras), graphical user interfaces, network communication, data management, and others.

In collaboration with our service technicians, you qualify and refine your software modules to meet our customers' needs. Occasionally, you deploy new solutions to our customers abroad.

Your profile

A Master or Engineering degree or a PhD in a technical field.

A proven practice of C++

Fluent English, spoken and written. We have colleagues of 15 nationalities, English is our common language

Preferably 2 to 3 years in a similar position, but young graduate accepted

Additional skills

image processing or computer vision

Hardware integration (cameras, acquisition cards...)

development of User Interfaces using QT.

real time processing and multi-threading

network communication, including real time bus.

German language would be an asset.

Your personality

You are open minded and ready to work in a multicultural environment

You have a great team spirit which is really important to share your daily tasks with your future colleagues in an open space

You have the ability to work in autonomy

Don't hesitate to apply via the button below!

Description:
Data Engineer (m/f/gn)
Department: Energy Business IT | Location: Esch-sur-Alzette | Contract: Permanent | Job Requisition N°18363

You manage the data integration pipelines of the Enovos IT ecosystem to the target data lakes/data marts

Description:
WANTED: Senior Data Engineer

We (TLI SERVICES) are currently looking for a Senior Data Engineer to integrate a fast-growing Luxembourgish company.

By joining the TLI SERVICES Consultant Team, you will contribute to its growth and become a superhero in the company by being THE Master of Data.

Do you want to participate in this adventure?

Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in computer engineering, computer science, or a similar technical field
Availability to complete an internship minimum 6 months long working full time week
Experience with one or more query language (e.g., SQL, PL/SQL, DDL, MDX, HiveQL, SparkSQL, Scala)
Experience with one or more scripting language (e.g., Python, KornShell)
Experience with data mining, data warehouse solutions
Experience with ETL flow and tools

Job summary
We’re on the lookout for the curious, those who think big and want to define the world of tomorrow. At Amazon, you will grow into the high impact, visionary person you know you’re ready to be. Every day will be filled with exciting new challenges, developing new skills, and achieving personal growth.

How often can you say that your work changes the world? At Amazon, you’ll say it often. Join us and define tomorrow.

2023 Luxemburg Data Engineering Internship

Do you love building tools and data pipelines? Are you excited by the opportunity to create clear effective reports and data visualizations, and collaborate with stakeholders to answer key business questions? Do you want to be a part of a fast-paced environment and contribute to one of the most visited sites on the Internet?

If this describes you, consider joining us as an intern. Amazon is looking for a data engineer intern to join one our many lines of business. Amazon interns have the opportunity to work alongside the industry’s brightest engineers who innovate everyday on behalf of our customers. You will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to affect the evolution of Amazon technology as well as lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your work will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the company.

In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in fun activities with other interns throughout the summer. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your summer and learn in a real world setting.

Key job responsibilities

A day in the life
Our Data Engineers build and maintain the infrastructure to answer questions with data, using software engineering best practices, data management fundamentals, data storage principles, and recent advances in distributed systems (e g MapReduce, MPP architectures, NoSQL database. We’re looking for Data Engineer interns to join one of our many lines of business.



About the team
If you’re insatiably curious and always want to learn more, then you’ve come to the right place. Depending on your location, country, job status and other requirements, some or all of the following benefits may be available to you as an intern.

If you’re successful during your internship, you could be considered for a graduate role after finishing your university studies

Internship start dates vary throughout the year.
Internship ideal length is 6 months.

We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and leveraging our unique perspectives to scale our impact and grow. Amazon has 13 affinity groups (https://www.aboutamazon.com/affinity-groups), sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. With executive and company sponsorship, these groups play an important role in building internal networks for creating a community, advising Amazon business units, leading in service projects, and reaching out to communities where Amazonians live and work.
Want to know more about our opportunities? Visit our EMEA Student Programs Team Events page to register for one of our upcoming events: https://amazonstudentevents.splashthat.com/careers

Description:
Created in 2000, NEOFACTO is a major player that supports companies in their digitalization. Navigating between the creativity of startups and the experience of large groups, NEOFACTO has the ability to position itself and adapt to all projects. Guided by our passion for innovation, we support our customers with the goal of pioneering the new technologies and commercial models of tomorrow. Are we a dynamic and innovative team? Yes! And above all, a team that is united and driven by a very strong corporate culture. We share and cultivate common values to build together the NEOFACTO of tomorrow! You will join us for an opportunity and stay for the people around you."

Context

We are currently recruiting for an automation tester to work for one of our clients in the banking sector.

Missions

Maintain existing test suite (auto and manual)

Write test scripts for manual tests and create test data for complex integrated system

Implement tests automation using Katalon / Selenium (FE and BE)

Build test plan, perform test execution, report issues and perform quality checks after issue resolution

Document testing activities (management of test execution results in test management tool, contribute to creation of test reports reports and quality assurance metrics)

Reviews test scenarios, scripts and test data developed by other team members

Develop test scenarios for functional, integration, usability and performance testing based on business and technical requirements

Support the application releases, by monitoring and stabilizing the existing automated test suites execution

Participate in manual regression testing

Skills

Katalon experience is considered an advantage

Experience in financial/ banking domain will be considered an asset

SQL, relational databases

Experience with test automation Selenium with Java mandatory, SoapUI, source code repository (e.g GitHub), continuous integration tool (Jenkins)

Ability to document and troubleshoot errors

Proven experience in a testing environment in cross-functional teams

Test/QA certifications is a plus

Strong organizational skills, good time management skills

Experience using test management/tracking tools (e.g. Jira, Xray)

Very good communication skills in English, both verbal and written

Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related (technical) degree/diploma will be considered an asset

Proven hands on experience in script development using scripting languages

Recruitment process

The pre-qualification interview with our Recruiter Florient Lenet

Receipt of our salary proposal / exclusivity agreement

2nd interview with our Business Manager Evgeniya Weibel-Zimmer

Technical tests and / or interview with our CTO Florian Sey

Proposal of your application to the client

Interview at the client's premises, which can be conducted either by video or in person

Our offer

Working in a Great Place to Work based in Luxembourg, Paris and Brussels

Attractive salary and pretty cool benefits (meal vouchers, mobile subscription, car...)

Develop your skills and ideas over a coffee, a beer or a pizza during our Neo'vations

Evolve within a strong company culture, you'll join us for the opportunity and you'll stay because we're super cool (well according to 97% of our employees NEOFACTO Annual Survey 2022)

Between afterworks, innovative workshops and ski weekends, there's never a dull moment when you're part of the Neo'Squad

Founded in 1856, Banque Internationale à Luxembourg is the oldest multi-business bank in the Grand Duchy. From its foundation, the BIL has always played an active role in the development of the Luxembourg economy. It currently operates in retail, private and corporate banking, as well as on major capital markets. Employing more than 2 000 people, BIL is present in the financial hotspots that are Luxembourg, Switzerland, and China.
As a major player in Luxembourg’s finance industry and as a signatory of the UN Principles of Responsible Banking, BIL is committed to handing over a responsible and sustainable bank to future generations.
Your mission

As a member of Data Value Chain, helped by your recent experience on ETL tools (ideally Oracle Data Integrator) you participate in the project of the new Core Banking System T24 and the exploitation of its data. You’ll participate in the delivery of a new Business Datawarehouse and its datamarts, feeding Downstream Components, other applications and supporting Reporting.

Description:
Hays plc est l'un des principaux groupes mondiaux de recrutement de professionnels. Hays est l'expert du recrutement de personnes qualifiées, professionnelles et compétentes dans le monde entier. Hays est le leader du marché au Royaume-Uni et en Asie-Pacifique et également l'un des leaders du marché en Europe continentale et en Amérique latine. Hays intervient pour le compte de milliers d'entreprises des secteurs privé et public, sur des postes en CDI, CDD, Travail Temporaire et Contracting.

Hays France & Luxembourg compte aujourd'hui plus de 650 salariés répartis au sein de 22 bureaux (Aix-en-Provence, Amiens, Biarritz, Bordeaux, Clermont-Ferrand, Dijon, Grenoble, La Rochelle, Lille, Lyon, Montpellier, Nancy, Nantes, Nice, Paris, Reims, Rennes, Rouen, Strasbourg, Toulouse, Tours et au Luxembourg) couvrant 25 secteurs d'activité.

We are currently recruiting for one of its clients which is an IT company. This company was created to meet the needs of a specific banking client.

Due to expansion of the team, we are looking for Digital Banking Software Engineers to support the activity of our funds management experts.

In this context, your mission will be to

Deliver shippable features as part of a dedicated Scrum team

Suggest, influence, develop and implement innovative solutions to improve and enrich our software solution portfolio

Depending on your experience, accompany and coach junior developers in your area of expertise .

Our ideal candidate

Advanced degree in Software Engineering.

Very good knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL with practical experience

Proven experience of RDBMS model and Oracle Database

Knowledge of Talend ETL is a strong plus

Good knowledge of Java, Spring and Hibernate. Rest would be ideal too

Good grasp on object-oriented programming and design, development and Web-based development

Keen interest in front and back-end developments

Experience in writing unit test, mock services and data mocking to produce software quality

Knowledge of industrial software development tools and practices is a plus: GIT, Jira, Continuous Integration, Micro-Service architecture, Docker containers, VM concepts.

Experience in Temenos MultiFonds Global Accounting (FA), Global Inverstor (TA)

Aei, FATCA, CRS, PRIIPs, MiFID, EMIR, AML, KYC

agility is about collaboration, growing together, supporting more junior team members, intellectual humility and strong desire to learn

Proven ability to deliver against deadlines

True team player as teamwork is at the heart of everything we do

Fluency in English, both written and verbal, French is a plus.

In addition to solid technical knowledge and experience, we are looking for passionate individuals with a well-rounded personality and a good sense of humor: we don't compromise on these.

What we offer

An innovative and supportive working culture fostering collaboration, professional development and learning opportunities

Top-notch technologies and premium Hardware

An opportunity to work and grow alongside inspiring individuals

A room for open and meaningful discussions across the organization

A SAFe place to share and promote your ideas and vision

flexitime, state of the art facilities, dynamic organization

excellence, integrity, respect, fun

Description:
Charles Oakes is a leading IT Solutions Organisation established in Luxembourg in 2005. Our Solutions and Services are provided to a client base which includes both official institutions and commercial organisations. Since foundation the organisation has delivered consistent and healthy growth with a significant team across the globe.

Alongside our clients' own methodologies and requirements, Charles Oakes has adopted and adapted Industry Best Practices and Methodologies for our own business and service delivery. We continually monitor developments and evolution across this field.

Our organisation has achieved ISO9001 certification from Lloyds Register Quality Assurance, one of the most prestigious and rigorous bodies authorised to award this certification. ISO9001 is the internationally recognised standard for the quality management of businesses. It applies to the processes that create and control the products and services that Charles Oakes supplies, and requires systematic control of activities to ensure that the needs and expectations of clients and partners are consistently met.

Our Quality Management System (QMS) is an integral part of our operations and essential to the quality of our delivery model. Additionally it motivates our own resources by clearly defining key roles and responsibilities. We have gained considerable cost savings thorough improved efficiency and productivity. These improvements result in less waste and greater satisfaction from our clients and in combination with ISO9001, enable us to deliver consistently, on time and to the correct specification.

C# & Python Software Engineers, Join our team. You will have the opportunity to work with our experienced team supporting the work of the European Investment Bank (EIB), in the stunning city of Luxembourg.

As a key team member you will develop and support key software driving investment in clean energy, sustainable living and inovative development across Europe.

Tasks

Experience in Software development in C#

Experience with Data Analysis and ETL using Python

Hands on experience in script development using scripting languages

Experience in the banking/ financial domain

Good knowledge of SQL & relational databases

Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related (technical) degree/diploma will be considered an asset:

Fluent English, French is an asset.

We invite suitable candidates to send a CV in English quoting reference BBBH1601 via the button below.

Description:
CTG is an international IT solutions and services company, back over 50 years of experience.

CTG IT Solutions, part of the CTG Group is dedicated specifically to the European Institutions. More than 200 colleagues are working within multicultural teams in Brussels, Luxembourg, and Strasbourg.
We provide to the European Institutions all kind of IT services, such as IT Service Management (ITSM) like Service Desk and Helpdesk or infrastructure services, but also Application Solutions (Analysis, Development, Maintenance & Project Management) and Test Management. No fewer than 27 nationalities share their expertise and learn from each other.

Our goal? Keep on growing, in a serene and pragmatic way, preserving our philosophy of proximity and cooperation. Certified “Best Workplace in 2021”, we advocate multiculturalism, regular monitoring and open communication.

Our projects with European Institutions are unique. You are an IT professional looking for a challenging position in an international and multi-cultural environment ? Join CTG ! As your career evolves, you will receive steady support from a well-established and growing company, that is seeking your talent !

CTG IT Solutions is currently looking for a Senior Backend Developer within the European Institutions in Luxembourg.

Your missions

You will work mostly in an Agile mode

You will mainly see tasks related to build a solid REST API for the internal frontend developments.

You will build a new ReactJS frontend for the EIB lending application.

You will help the team to rebuild an existing legacy large frontend

Your profile

You have a valid work permit in Luxembourg

You are Fluent in English, other EU language will be an asset

You have at least 6 years of experience in backend development

You have a high experience in Java EE and/or SpringBoot, with designing REST APIs, SQL and Data Design

An experience with JBoss and Oracle will be an asset

An experience with Jira, IntelliJ, GIT, Jenkins, Sonar, Nexus, Fortify is a significant plus.

Our offer

An attractive salary package with or without a company car

5 additional vacation days each year

A dedicated training program with personal development plans

Extra-legal advantages (IT material, banks, ...)

learning lunchs, team buildings, fun events, Xmas, Marathons, ...

If you like multicultural teams and want to join a company with open communication, then apply right now via the button below!

Please note that a criminal record will be asked for this position.

NTT is a leading global IT solutions and services organisation that brings together people, data and things to create a better and more sustainable future.
In today's 'iNTTerconnected' world, connections matter more now than ever. By bringing together talented people, world-class technology partners and emerging innovators, we help our clients solve some of the world's most significant technological, business and societal challenges.
With people at the heart of our success, NTT is committed to attracting and growing the best talent and providing an environment where everyone feels they can belong and their contribution matters.
Are you ready to take the next step in your career?

The Sr. Technical Program Manager will be part of the delivery team that drives the development of private cloud solutions. With Technical skills to design and implement IT services, processes and tooling, the Sr. Technical Program Manager will define, design, drive changes and focus on high quality, on-time successful releases.

In this high-visibility and high business impact role the Sr. Technical Program Manager will build plans, identify and manage risks, ensuring quality and focusing on critical issues at the right time. The Sr. Technical Program Management makes sure the right features, experience, quality, schedule, continuity, service capability are delivered.

Key responsibilities

Provide the guidance on development and project management, cross-functional coordination, and inter/intra team communications to deliver outstanding program outcomes.

Lead teams through transition from ideation to execution

Define projects; requirements gathering, write detailed functional and test specifications, coordinate efforts to scope, schedule and deploy new feature sets

Collaborate with development teams to build and launch new services, features and programs

Work closely with engineers, QA, service owner and other teams to get high-quality solutions and features through the project lifecycle (build, test and release on time).

Manage project schedules, identify possible issues and clearly communicate them to program/project stakeholders.

Take responsibility for release schedules and milestones, keeping up a high velocity in a fast-paced environment.

Lead program setting priorities for releases and solutions.

Lead the project team through each phase of the program

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field

10+ years' experience in a technical project or program management role

Understanding of SDLC and modern development with services

Ability to work with cross-functional teams to establish and maintain roadmaps, setting appropriate expectations and insuring services meet high operational excellence standards

A demonstrated ability to think broadly and strategically on the direction of cloud-based solutions and make recommendations with fact based discussions and presentations.

Experience and ability to understand multiple technologies and how they interact for the benefit of customers, delivered in a Cloud environment.

Strong verbal/written communication skills are a must

Judgement, maturity, negotiation/influence skills, analytical skills and leadership skills

Experience communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

Experience in working on large cloud DataCenter development and deployment with ambitious timelines and/or constrained resources.

Comfortable defining and executing complex program with intimate understanding of dependencies, critical paths, key and critical landmarks, and results.

Service-oriented mind-set;

Fluent in English (written and spoken) is essential;

Any other European language is a plus.

Knowledge of ITIL functions and processes;

Preferred skills

Experience managing cloud development projects

Experience in enterprise cloud solutions (Azure, AWS, Etc.)

Experience with IT service design

Experience leading and deploying on public and private cloud framework;

Experience with containers projects, container architecture and how it is used in enterprise.

Familiar on Docker architecture, Kubernetes and Software engineering.

Relevant domain experience within either core infrastructure & ideally Virtualization and software defined infrastructure

Description:
INTEGRATION ENGINEER (M/F/D)

The Integration Engineer’s role is to support planning, coordination and integration of cloud platforms, applications and data flows through development of interfaces related to the integration of cloud platforms, software programs, applications, and third-party solutions as required.

This is a hands on role, responsible for developing and maintaining a platform and application solution architecture blueprint for the organization, including definition of master data sources in collaboration with the Data management team. The role also oversees testing of the interoperability of platforms and application modules under development by in-house software development teams, commercial-off-the-shelf software deployed in the organization and with external third parties, as necessary.

Description:
R&D specialist for MFN group

About us...

The Luxembourg Centre for Systems Biomedicine (LCSB) is an interdisciplinary research centre of the University of Luxembourg. We conduct fundamental and translational research in the field of Systems Biology and Biomedicine – in the lab, in the clinic and in silico. We focus on neurodegenerative processes and are especially interested in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s disease and their contributing factors.

The LCSB recruits talented scientists from various disciplines: computer scientists, mathematicians, biologists, chemists, engineers, physicists and clinicians from more than 50 countries currently work at the LCSB. We excel because we are truly interdisciplinary and together we contribute to science and society.

Description:
NTT is a leading global IT solutions and services organisation that brings together people, data and things to create a better and more sustainable future.
In today's 'iNTTerconnected' world, connections matter more now than ever. By bringing together talented people, world-class technology partners and emerging innovators, we help our clients solve some of the world's most significant technological, business and societal challenges.
With people at the heart of our success, NTT is committed to attracting and growing the best talent and providing an environment where everyone feels they can belong and their contribution matters.
Are you ready to take the next step in your career?

The Sr. Technical Program Manager will be part of the delivery team that drives the development of private cloud solutions. With Technical skills to design and implement IT services, processes and tooling, the Sr. Technical Program Manager will define, design, drive changes and focus on high quality, on-time successful releases.

In this high-visibility and high business impact role the Sr. Technical Program Manager will build plans, identify and manage risks, ensuring quality and focusing on critical issues at the right time. The Sr. Technical Program Management makes sure the right features, experience, quality, schedule, continuity, service capability are delivered.

Key responsibilities

Provide the guidance on development and project management, cross-functional coordination, and inter/intra team communications to deliver outstanding program outcomes.

Lead teams through transition from ideation to execution

Define projects; requirements gathering, write detailed functional and test specifications, coordinate efforts to scope, schedule and deploy new feature sets

Collaborate with development teams to build and launch new services, features and programs

Work closely with engineers, QA, service owner and other teams to get high-quality solutions and features through the project lifecycle (build, test and release on time).

Manage project schedules, identify possible issues and clearly communicate them to program/project stakeholders.

Take responsibility for release schedules and milestones, keeping up a high velocity in a fast-paced environment.

Lead program setting priorities for releases and solutions.

Lead the project team through each phase of the program

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field

10+ years' experience in a technical project or program management role

Understanding of SDLC and modern development with services

Ability to work with cross-functional teams to establish and maintain roadmaps, setting appropriate expectations and insuring services meet high operational excellence standards

A demonstrated ability to think broadly and strategically on the direction of cloud-based solutions and make recommendations with fact based discussions and presentations.

Experience and ability to understand multiple technologies and how they interact for the benefit of customers, delivered in a Cloud environment.

Strong verbal/written communication skills are a must

Judgement, maturity, negotiation/influence skills, analytical skills and leadership skills

Experience communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences.

Experience in working on large cloud DataCenter development and deployment with ambitious timelines and/or constrained resources.

Comfortable defining and executing complex program with intimate understanding of dependencies, critical paths, key and critical landmarks, and results.

Service-oriented mind-set;

Fluent in English (written and spoken) is essential;

Any other European language is a plus.

Knowledge of ITIL functions and processes;

Preferred skills

Experience managing cloud development projects

Experience in enterprise cloud solutions (Azure, AWS, Etc.)

Experience with IT service design

Experience leading and deploying on public and private cloud framework;

Experience with containers projects, container architecture and how it is used in enterprise.

Familiar on Docker architecture, Kubernetes and Software engineering.

Relevant domain experience within either core infrastructure & ideally Virtualization and software defined infrastructure

SnT is a leading international research and innovation centre in secure, reliable and trustworthy ICT systems and services. We play an instrumental role in Luxembourg by fueling innovation through research partnerships with industry, boosting R&D investments leading to economic growth, and attracting highly qualified talent.

We’re headquartered in Luxembourg, but we have offices and plants in the U.S., Europe and Asia. We’re a global company with the local expertise to ensure our customers receive the support they need and we’re proud that our innovative sensing solutions enable people to lead better, safer and easier lives. A company is only as good as its people. And, as we always want to be at the top of our game, you’ll need to be there too if you want to work with us. We are currently looking for the right person to join our Embedded Software Development Department as a:

Software Project Coordinator (m/f)
Located in Bissen / Luxembourg

Description:
The Luxembourg Centre for Systems Biomedicine (LCSB) is an interdisciplinary research centre of the University of Luxembourg. We conduct fundamental and translational research in the field of Systems Biology and Biomedicine – in the lab, in the clinic and in silico. We focus on neurodegenerative processes and are especially interested in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s disease and their contributing factors.
The LCSB recruits talented scientists from various disciplines: computer scientists, mathematicians, biologists, chemists, engineers, physicists and clinicians from more than 50 countries currently work at the LCSB. We excel because we are truly interdisciplinary and together we contribute to science and society.
Successful candidates will join the Bioinformatics Core, led by Prof. Reinhard Schneider, whose research revolves around a better accessibility and interpretation of the ever increasing but often messy data. The group develops algorithms for data mining and visualization and works on methodologies to more easily improve the FAIRification of data. For more information, please visit our website.

Description:
Capgemini Engineering combines, under one brand, a unique set of strengths from across the Capgemini Group: the world leading engineering and R&D services of Altran – acquired by Capgemini in 2020 - and Capgemini's digital manufacturing expertise. With broad industry knowledge and cutting-edge technologies in digital and software, Capgemini Engineering supports the convergence of the physical and digital worlds. Combined with the capabilities of the rest of the Group, it helps clients to accelerate their journey towards Intelligent Industry. Capgemini Engineering has more than 52,000 engineer and scientist team members in over 30 countries across sectors including aeronautics, automotive, railways, communications, energy, life sciences, semiconductors, software & internet, space & defence, and consumer products.

Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of the Capgemini Group, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided every day by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of 270,000 team members in nearly 50 countries. With its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported in 2020 global revenues of €16 billion.

Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

Description:
About Vantage Data Centers

Vantage is committed to being a workplace of inclusion, equity, respect and acceptance. We celebrate diversity and intentionally seek out opportunities to learn from one another’s experience.
Vantage Data Centers powers, cools, protects and connects the technology of the world’s well-known hyperscalers, cloud providers and large enterprises. Developing and operating across North America, EMEA and Asia Pacific, Vantage has evolved data center design in innovative ways to deliver dramatic gains in reliability, efficiency and sustainability in flexible environments that can scale as quickly as the market demands.
Position Overview
The Customer Solutions Engineer is responsible for the support of a successful development and execution of a technical solutions program. This key sales solutions & engineering team member will evidence a track record of measurable sophisticated solutions and engineering experience. A strategic problem solver and a specialist at tactical execution with ideally strong communication and presentation skills across the spectrum of Vantage's various teams. Experience with wholesale data centers, colocation, interconnection, cloud, managed solutions and professional services is preferred otherwise experience within critical environments like nuclear plants, hospitals, and submarines would be desired.

Description:
We are looking for a Quality Assurance software engineer to design, implement, debug, and integrate modules of the satellite Network Management System based on Skyline’s Dataminer framework. This is part of the multiservice satellite communications platform that allows satellite service providers to build and adapt their network easily as their business grows. The job is based in the center of Europe, in the multicultural city of Luxembourg.
You will be an integral part of a committed team of experienced, friendly, and talented colleagues, who are passionate about software development and support each other perfectly. You will have the chance to work with innovative technologies and take a leading role in shaping the satellite communications of the future.
You will be responsible for the Quality Assurance of the satellite Network Management System and all the modules that it contains. You will define the test strategy inside the scrum team and decide on the best combination of automated, manual, and exploratory testing to provide the best possible coverage for the various modules and components that make up the NMS system.

Availability to complete ideally a 6 months + internship working full time week

Experience with data querying or modelling with SQL, Excel

We’re on the lookout for the curious, those who think big and want to define the world of tomorrow. At Amazon, you will grow into the high impact, visionary person you know you’re ready to be. Every day will be filled with exciting new challenges, developing new skills, and achieving personal growth.

How often can you say that your work changes the world? At Amazon, you’ll say it often. Join us and define tomorrow

2023 Business Intelligence Engineer Internship- Luxemburg

Do you enjoy solving complex problems and troubleshooting products? Are you passionate about developing test strategies, finding, and tracking bugs to resolution, and innovating on behalf of customers? Do you want to be a part of a fast-paced, ambiguous environment and contribute to one of the most visited sites on the Internet?

At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – customer obsession is part of our company DNA. Business intelligence engineers use cutting-edge technology to solve complex problems and get to see the impact of their work first-hand.

The challenges business intelligence engineers solve for at Amazon are big and affect millions of customers, sellers, and products around the world. Our path is not always simple, so we are selective about who joins us on this journey. There is a certain kind of person who takes on this role at Amazon – someone who is excited by the idea of creating new products, features, and services from scratch while managing ambiguity and the pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.
The Amazon EU Student Programs Team are looking for ambitious students to join us as interns at the heart of our core consumer business! Internships are flexible in length to fit in with your university’s placement scheme.

Key job responsibilities

A day in the life
Our Business Intelligence Engineer builds data pipelines, reports, dashboards, and analyses to deliver metrics and insights to the business.
Our Business Intelligence Engineers tackle some of the most complex challenges in large scale
computing, work in small teams across the company to contribute to the e-commerce platform that's used by millions of people all over the world. With that in mind, we require applicants to demonstrate their technical skills in a number of areas.

About the team
If you’re insatiably curious and always want to learn more, then you’ve come to the right place. Depending on your location, country, job status and other requirements, some or all of the following benefits may be available to you as an intern.

If you’re successful during your internship, you could be considered for a graduate role after finishing your university studies.

Internship start dates vary throughout the year.
Internship length is ideally 6 months.

We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and leveraging our unique perspectives to scale our impact and grow. Amazon has 13 affinity groups (https://www.aboutamazon.com/affinity-groups), sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. With executive and company sponsorship, these groups play an important role in building internal networks for creating a community, advising Amazon business units, leading in service projects, and reaching out to communities where Amazonians live and work.
Want to know more about our opportunities? Visit our EMEA Student Programs Team Events page to register for one of our upcoming events: https://amazonstudentevents.splashthat.com/careers

Description:
Electronics Test Design Engineer
Luxembourg – On-site
-For avoidance of doubt, this is not an engineering test role and you will not usually execute recurring testing-
At EVONA we are looking for a Electronics Test Design Engineer to join our client’s design team to develop, test, qualify and initialise manufacture of modules for a deep-space avionics stack.
We offer you the chance to participate in the development a completely new type of modular flight avionics system that will enable a new class of deep-space missions.
An opportunity to be a key part of exciting missions to the Moon - and beyond - launching in the near future.
You would take on an important role in a new, revenue-generating company, with a mandate to focus on technical design and implementation on an aggressive development schedule featuring rapid hardware iterations.
You would be working closely with experts in other avionics domains and contributing to their designs, giving the chance to learn about other spacecraft subsystems.
The role has a large degree of , with minimized technical constraints, building a fresh test architecture from the ground up.
The position is in a beautiful, cosmopolitan and welcoming country at the heart of Europe.

Unique, exciting, fun-loving, and fast-growing – Welcome to Docler Group which is the umbrella company of Byborg Enterprises! For our site in Belgium and the EMEA Headquarter in Luxembourg, we're looking for an IT Support Engineer.
The Role
As IT Support Engineer, based on site at the Avient Belgium and Luxemburg facilities, you will work closely with the members of the IT and Business teams to understand business requirements and deliver IT solutions to meet those needs. You'll be implementing technical designs, procedures, or operations. The role works within requirements to support certain applications and operations within the department and troubleshoots cases from the IT Service Desk. Being part of the EMEA regional Operations team, this position also contributes to various IT projects from concept to completion across EMEA.
Essential Functions

Description:
Working in close cooperation with your team, you will be responsible for the selection of mathematical methods and the development of algorithms to restore the third coordinate from distorted pattern data. The pattern is projected onto an object with some parallax disparity relative to the observation point. In addition to algorithms reconstructing the third coordinate, your tasks will include all necessary stages of image processing geared to improving the signal-to-noise ratio, the extraction of information about the position of the pattern’s key points in the projection, the decoding of the pattern, applicable mathematical methods and implementation of distortion correction, as well as the calibration and certification of an active 3D (structured-light) system. The scope of work can be extended beyond single-frame restoration to multi-frame processing, including registration and fusion.
Apply now

Description:
Capgemini Engineering combines, under one brand, a unique set of strengths from across the Capgemini Group: the world leading engineering and R&D services of Altran – acquired by Capgemini in 2020 - and Capgemini's digital manufacturing expertise. With broad industry knowledge and cutting-edge technologies in digital and software, Capgemini Engineering supports the convergence of the physical and digital worlds. Combined with the capabilities of the rest of the Group, it helps clients to accelerate their journey towards Intelligent Industry. Capgemini Engineering has more than 52,000 engineer and scientist team members in over 30 countries across sectors including aeronautics, automotive, railways, communications, energy, life sciences, semiconductors, software & internet, space & defence, and consumer products.

Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of the Capgemini Group, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided every day by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of 270,000 team members in nearly 50 countries. With its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported in 2020 global revenues of €16 billion.

Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

Job_title: Research Support Technician in computer vision for space applications
Description:
SnT is a leading international research and innovation centre in secure, reliable and trustworthy ICT systems and services. We play an instrumental role in Luxembourg by fueling innovation through research partnerships with industry, boosting R&D investments leading to economic growth, and attracting highly qualified talent.
We offer an attractive Research Support Technician in close cooperation with our industrial partner LMO, an innovative company that adopts an open-minded approach to the world thanks to its constantly evolving activities to provide the right innovation to make satellites (www.lmo.space). The successful candidate will join the Computer Vision, Machine Intelligence and Imaging (CVI²) research group (www.cvi2.uni.lu) headed by Prof. Djamila Aouada to work on the framework of a European Space Agency project in the field of Computer Vision applied for space applications.
We’re looking for people driven by excellence, excited about innovation, and looking to make a difference. If this sounds like you, you’ve come to the right place!

Job_title: Internship - EAGLE-1 Key Management System Software Development
Description:
ROLE DESCRIPTION
Are you looking for a 6-month internship in Engineering, starting in summer 2023 ?

Join SES with this exciting opportunity to become part of an interdisciplinary team and learn more about the telecommunications and space industry within a fast-moving global organization within an innovative and unique industry.
Under the agreement with ESA, the SES-led consortium of industry partners will design, develop and validate in-orbit technologies for space-based quantum key distribution (QKD) and operate EAGLE-1 satellite to securely connect countries in Europe.
Under the guidance of our lead software engineer, participate in the C++ development of the EAGLE-1 Key Management System (KMS) that will manage the EAGLE-1 on-board generation and satellite distribution of optical quantum-keys.


In this context, you will be responsible for (this is not an exhaustive list):

Description:
Capgemini Engineering combines, under one brand, a unique set of strengths from across the Capgemini Group: the world leading engineering and R&D services of Altran – acquired by Capgemini in 2020 - and Capgemini's digital manufacturing expertise. With broad industry knowledge and cutting-edge technologies in digital and software, Capgemini Engineering supports the convergence of the physical and digital worlds. Combined with the capabilities of the rest of the Group, it helps clients to accelerate their journey towards Intelligent Industry. Capgemini Engineering has more than 52,000 engineer and scientist team members in over 30 countries across sectors including aeronautics, automotive, railways, communications, energy, life sciences, semiconductors, software & internet, space & defence, and consumer products.

Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of the Capgemini Group, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided every day by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of 270,000 team members in nearly 50 countries. With its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported in 2020 global revenues of €16 billion.

Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

Job_title: CIX Management G.I.E. - System and Application Engineer
Description:
LU-CIX ASBL, the Luxembourg Internet exchange, was founded in 2009 based on a not-for-profit membership association with an open and neutral philosophy. Its aim is to develop and support the Internet and data centre ecosystem in Luxembourg by providing the national peering infrastructure and by promoting the national and European ICT community.

LU-CIX brings a major contribution to the Luxembourg Internet community by organising its leading industry event, the Luxembourg Internet Days, which takes place every year and attracts over a thousand industry experts and decision makers from all around the globe.

LU-CIX also runs the datacenters-in-europe.com platform, which gathers the Luxembourg data centre and Internet related players to promote Luxembourg as the best place for a data centre and ICT business in the heart of Europe.

LU-CIX GIE was also launched in 2009 to operate the Internet exchange infrastructure. In 2021, the Luxembourgish State, together with LU-CIX GIE, launched MyConnectivity G.I.E. to support the access to high performance connectivity for all (private households and businesses) in the context of the 5G and ultra-high-speed national strategies.

More information at lu-cix.lu.

LU-CIX Management G.I.E. (Luxembourg Internet Exchange) is looking for a System and application engineer (m/f).

LU-CIX operates the national Internet exchange backbone and has ambitious extension plans. Be part of a small and fast-moving company. In an engaged and motivated team, you will be responsible for operating mobile apps, applications and their related IT systems and databases in the context of an exciting new project.

If you're interested to help run cool OpenSource apps in a growing Unix shop, where Windows only exist to let the sun shine in, we might have a place for you. If you automate and script everything in your world, we want to talk to you - and if you want to find out together with us, that's fine too.

Main tasks

Manage and operate OpenSource application stacks

Test custom developed mobile and desktop apps

Follow-up external app development

Manage and operate the LU-CIX IT system infrastructure

Level 2 support for customer helpdesks

Automate recurring tasks, script application configuration and deployment

Monitor operational parameters

Ensure optimized security and performance of the applications

You will be required to participate in a 24X7 on-call rotation

Skills

Software lifecycle management

Mobile app ecosystem

Unix system administration

Database administration

Virtualization and containerization technologies

IT automation and DevOps operation

Good knowledge of TCP/IP networking

Authentication standards, single sign on, ...

Scripting languages

Good understanding of application and system security measures

You should display team spirit, be flexible, show decision-making skills and be organized

Education and experience

Bachelor or Master degree in computer science or equivalent

At least 5 years of work experience

Be fluent in French and English

Understanding and speaking Luxemburgish will be considered as an asset

Interested?

Please send your application including your CV and motivation letter in English via the button below.

The first selection will be based on the curriculum vitae and motivation letters.

Job_title: Research Support Technician in computer vision for space applications
Description:
SnT is a leading international research and innovation centre in secure, reliable and trustworthy ICT systems and services. We play an instrumental role in Luxembourg by fueling innovation through research partnerships with industry, boosting R&D investments leading to economic growth, and attracting highly qualified talent.
We offer an attractive Research Support Technician in close cooperation with our industrial partner LMO, an innovative company that adopts an open-minded approach to the world thanks to its constantly evolving activities to provide the right innovation to make satellites (www.lmo.space). The successful candidate will join the Computer Vision, Machine Intelligence and Imaging (CVI²) research group (www.cvi2.uni.lu) headed by Prof. Djamila Aouada to work on the framework of a European Space Agency project in the field of Computer Vision applied for space applications.
We’re looking for people driven by excellence, excited about innovation, and looking to make a difference. If this sounds like you, you’ve come to the right place!

Job_title: Internship - EAGLE-1 Key Management System Software Development

ROLE DESCRIPTION
Are you looking for a 6-month internship in Engineering, starting in summer 2023 ?

Join SES with this exciting opportunity to become part of an interdisciplinary team and learn more about the telecommunications and space industry within a fast-moving global organization within an innovative and unique industry.
Under the agreement with ESA, the SES-led consortium of industry partners will design, develop and validate in-orbit technologies for space-based quantum key distribution (QKD) and operate EAGLE-1 satellite to securely connect countries in Europe.
Under the guidance of our lead software engineer, participate in the C++ development of the EAGLE-1 Key Management System (KMS) that will manage the EAGLE-1 on-board generation and satellite distribution of optical quantum-keys.

Since 1993, EPAM Systems, Inc. (NYSE: EPAM) has leveraged its advanced software engineering heritage to become the foremost global digital transformation services provider – leading the industry in digital and physical product development and digital platform engineering services. Through its innovative strategy; integrated advisory, consulting, and design capabilities; and unique 'Engineering DNA,' EPAM's globally deployed hybrid teams help make the future real for clients and communities around the world by powering better enterprise, education and health platforms that connect people, optimize experiences, and improve people's lives. In 2021, EPAM was added to the S&P 500 and included among the list of Forbes Global 2000 companies.

Selected by Newsweek as a 2021 and 2022 Most Loved Workplace, EPAM's global multi-disciplinary teams serve customers in more than 50 countries across six continents. As a recognized leader, EPAM is listed among the top 15 companies in Information Technology Services on the Fortune 1000 and ranked four times as the top IT services company on Fortune's 100 Fastest Growing Companies list. EPAM is also listed among Ad Age's top 25 World's Largest Agency Companies for three consecutive years, and Consulting Magazine named EPAM Continuum a top 20 Fastest Growing Firm.

Description:
Tracing its origins to 1585, Deutsche Börse Group has become one of the world's leading exchange organisations and an innovative market infrastructure provider. In this role, we provide investors, financial institutions and companies access to global capital markets. By creating trust in the markets of today and tomorrow we foster growth and contribute to the prosperity of future generations. Deutsche Börse Group is an international company, headquartered in Frankfurt/Main, Germany. With more than 6,700 employees, the company has a strong global presence for its customers all over the world, including Luxembourg, Prague, Chicago, London, Cork, New York and many other locations. Clearstream is a leading European supplier of post-trading services. The wholly owned subsidiary of Deutsche Börse ensures that cash and securities are promptly and effectively delivered between trading parties. Clearstream Luxembourg offers an international, diverse and inclusive working environment. There are numerous good reasons to work for us: high level of responsibility at an early stage, attractive benefits and a broad variety of career opportunities.

Your area of work

The mission of the unit is to provide secure IT environments to enable Clearstream to support its business processes in the most efficient manner. This involves protecting data and IT systems. In particular, the unit aims to ensure the confidentiality, integrity and availability of data, the availability of all essential components of the underlying IT architecture and the correct functioning of the associated IT processes.

Your responsibilities

Maintain operational effectiveness and perform operational duties of the Linux / Windows environments, in accordance with the relevant security policies, standards and procedures. This is not limited to the Linux/Windows OS level but also covers the management of other security tools (such our Token authentication, Access Management and Cisco solutions etc...) in a DevOps and hybrid On-Prem/Cloud based environments

Perform user management administration activities following established policies and instructions

Maintain and improve our existing automation processes

Interact with internal users as well as with other IT teams or external users, to ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction is achieved

Work closely with the support team, providing support, to ensure the incidents are adequately resolved

Ensure compliance of our systems based on internal security guidelines but also with external audit and regulatory requirements

Implement standard changes and service requests

Maintain appropriate confidentiality regarding user changes

Documentation management

On-call service, flextime and work-from-home opportunities

Your profile

University degree BAC+2/3 or higher technical degree in an IT related discipline or equivalent through relevant work experience (+3 years)

Good knowledge in Linux server (RedHat, CentOS) and scripting languages (e.g. Python, Bash)

Good knowledge in Windows server (and Active Directory) and scripting languages (e.g. PowerShell)

Previous support experience with functional knowledge of user management tools and processes, including ticketing systems

Knowledge of Jira and GitHub would be an asset

Methodical attention to detail

Team player with good communication skills

Analytical mind, skill of prioritization

Fluency in English language, French and/or German considered as an asset

Description:
Role purpose

The Client Systems Engineers will support, maintain and improve the Client Workspace at Operating System level. Engineers will work to drive automation, integration, business continuity and enhance the customer experience. Engineers are expected to have a strong focus on system engineering, and the ability to deliver value. The Service Provider’s engineers shall have knowledge with Microsoft Windows Server 2016, 2019 and 2022 and experience with Windows Client10 or 11.

Job responsibilities

Provide subject matter expertise in operating systems engineering;
Provide advanced technical support and serve as an escalation point for IT incidents and service requests, including with third parties (e.g. manufacturer or vendor) as necessary;
Technical and specific skills / Experience

About Getronics

Getronics is a global ICT integrator with a long history that extends over 135 years. With about 4,000 colleagues across Europe, Asia Pacific, and Latin America, Getronics’ vision is to reimagine the digital future, one customer at a time.

We do this by leveraging an integrated and secure-by-design portfolio around Digital Workplace, Business Applications, Smart Spaces, Multi-Cloud, Field & Onsite Support, Service Desk, Network Infrastructure, and Security & Compliance to serve our more than 1,400 customers in both public and private sector.

Getronics is the founder and leading member of the Global Workspace Alliance. This unique model provides customers with consistent IT services across 185 countries, with one single point of contact, contract, and billing entity yet maintaining the local touch with flexibility and cultural fit of a local partner.
